content:
Hi all,

I am starting to compose some questions from the National Childrens Digital Health Collaborative as we work on building out FHIR based information models. I will be posting details on the HL7 Australia Child Health Working Group Confluence page, however will post a summary of each question here.

The NCDHC solution will involve a set of discrete health interactions that each represent a relevant interaction that may form part of a larger clinical interaction/encounter. (there may be multiple health interactions invoked within a single clinical encounter for example undertaking a child health assement and updating family history are two discrete NCDHC health interactions that may both be performed in a single clinical encounter). What Method should be used to group the different elements / resources that make up a health interaction in a single logical group and indicate the type of health interaction they relate to?

More details at https://confluence.hl7australia.com/display/CHWG/Questions?focusedCommentId=14582254#comment-14582254

The O&O discussion regarding observations with interpretation and no value is here: https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/103-Orders-and.20Observation.20WG/topic/Observations.20with.20an.20interpretation.20and.20no.20value
